title: Confusion
data:
**Confusion**, or the state of being **confused**, is a [property](/wiki/Property "Property") that affects [you](/wiki/You "You").

Being confused is generally bad, although some scrolls have useful effects if read while confused.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Causes](#Causes)

- [2 Effects](#Effects)

- [3 Cures](#Cures)

- [4 Confused scroll effects](#Confused_scroll_effects)

- [5 Monster confusion](#Monster_confusion)

- [6 Variants](#Variants)

  - [6.1 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
  - [6.2 UnNetHack](#UnNetHack)

## Causes

Some of these actions have other bad effects in addition to causing confusion. If you are deliberately seeking to be confused, you may want to lock yourself in a closet so that monsters can't gang up on you.

- Attempting to cast a forgotten [spell](/wiki/Spell "Spell") (can also [stun](/wiki/Stun "Stun") you).[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)
- [Quaffing](/wiki/Quaff "Quaff") a [potion of confusion](/wiki/Potion_of_confusion "Potion of confusion") or a non-blessed [potion of booze](/wiki/Potion_of_booze "Potion of booze").[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)[\[3\]](#cite_note-3)
- Being affected by vapors of a [potion of confusion](/wiki/Potion_of_confusion "Potion of confusion") or [potion of booze](/wiki/Potion_of_booze "Potion of booze").[\[4\]](#cite_note-4)
- Reading a cursed [scroll of confuse monster](/wiki/Scroll_of_confuse_monster "Scroll of confuse monster"), or any scroll of confuse monster while polymorphed into any non-​@, or casting the [equivalent spell](/wiki/Spellbook_of_confuse_monster "Spellbook of confuse monster") while so polymorphed.[\[5\]](#cite_note-5)
- Eating a rotten [egg](/wiki/Egg "Egg"), a [tin](/wiki/Tin "Tin") of something rotten, or a [tripe ration](/wiki/Tripe_ration "Tripe ration") as a non-orc/caveman/canine in an attempt to become nauseated (any food item has a chance of making you vomit, but eggs and tripe rations have the highest chance. You will need to wait some time to be confused, and cure the nauseating side-effect as well).
- Applying a cursed [unicorn horn](/wiki/Unicorn_horn "Unicorn horn"). May cause other bad effects, including [terminal illness](/wiki/Sickness#illness "Sickness"). [\[6\]](#cite_note-6)
- Applying a mirror to yourself while polymorphed into an umber hulk.[\[7\]](#cite_note-7)
- Applying a charged [crystal ball](/wiki/Crystal_ball "Crystal ball") unsuccessfully (may cause other bad effects).[\[8\]](#cite_note-8)
- Reading a cursed or difficult spellbook (may cause other bad effects).[\[9\]](#cite_note-9)
- Trying to magic-map a non-mappable level.[\[10\]](#cite_note-10)
- Sitting on a [throne](/wiki/Throne "Throne").[\[11\]](#cite_note-11)
- Being hit by [Magicbane](/wiki/Magicbane "Magicbane"). This includes throwing it upward [<](/wiki/Angle_bracket "Angle bracket").
- Being exposed to an [umber hulk](/wiki/Umber_hulk "Umber hulk")'s [gaze attack](/wiki/Gaze_attack "Gaze attack").[\[12\]](#cite_note-12)
- Being attacked by a monster that casts [Confuse (monster spell)](/wiki/Confuse_\(monster_spell\) "Confuse (monster spell)").
- Being hit by [Yeenoghu](/wiki/Yeenoghu "Yeenoghu").

## Effects

- You cannot cast spells.[\[13\]](#cite_note-13)
- Attempting to loot while confused will find an object that is already in your inventory or cause you to drop some gold on the floor.[\[14\]](#cite_note-14)
- Looting a throne while confused has other effects; see [throne](/wiki/Throne "Throne").
- You will not be asked for confirmation before attacking peaceful monsters.
- When you walk, aim, or apply certain tools in a direction, there is a 20% chance of a random direction being chosen instead (similar to being [stunned](/wiki/Stunned "Stunned"), which has a 100% chance).[\[15\]](#cite_note-15)[\[16\]](#cite_note-16)[\[17\]](#cite_note-17)[\[18\]](#cite_note-18)[\[19\]](#cite_note-19)
- When [reading](/wiki/Read "Read") [scrolls](/wiki/Scroll "Scroll"), you will mispronounce the magic words, which will cause different effects from what would occur normally.[\[20\]](#cite_note-20)
- Reading any [spellbook](/wiki/Spellbook "Spellbook") will instead make you tear the book into pieces (1/3 chance) or else you will simply fail to learn it. ("You find yourself reading the \<first/next> line over and over again.")[\[21\]](#cite_note-21)
- Wisdom is abused.[\[22\]](#cite_note-22)
- You cannot throw or fire more than one projectile at a time.[\[23\]](#cite_note-23)
- If you throw [Mjollnir](/wiki/Mjollnir "Mjollnir") or an [aklys](/wiki/Aklys "Aklys"), the weapon will not return to your hand.[\[24\]](#cite_note-24)
- Your ability to engrave is impaired.[\[25\]](#cite_note-25)
- Your ability to play music is impaired. You cannot play a tune, and any magical instrument will behave as if you were playing its mundane counterpart.[\[26\]](#cite_note-26)[\[27\]](#cite_note-27)
- You are less able to saddle a [steed](/wiki/Steed "Steed") and cannot mount it.[\[28\]](#cite_note-28)[\[29\]](#cite_note-29)
- You cannot teleport at will.[\[30\]](#cite_note-30)
- You may be unable to control a [level teleport](/wiki/Level_teleport "Level teleport") ("Oops...") even if you have [teleport control](/wiki/Teleport_control "Teleport control") (4/5 chance of uncontrolled level teleport at zero [luck](/wiki/Luck "Luck")).[\[31\]](#cite_note-31)

## Cures

- [Applying](/wiki/Apply "Apply") a non-cursed [unicorn horn](/wiki/Unicorn_horn "Unicorn horn").
- Eating a [lizard](/wiki/Lizard "Lizard") corpse (reduces the timeout to 2 turns).
- [Praying](/wiki/Prayer "Prayer") (confusion counts as a [minor trouble](/wiki/Trouble "Trouble")).
- Reading a blessed [scroll of confuse monster](/wiki/Scroll_of_confuse_monster "Scroll of confuse monster").
- Waiting for it to wear off.

## Confused scroll effects

When you are confused, most scrolls have different effects.[\[32\]](#cite_note-32)

See the individual scroll pages for detailed information.

| ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | -------------------------------------------- | -------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------- |
| [Scroll of amnesia](/wiki/Scroll_of_amnesia "Scroll of amnesia")                         | Forgets less map                             | Forgets more spells, less map                | Forgets more spells                                     |

## Monster confusion

Monsters can be confused as well, but the effects on monsters are not identical to those that players experience. To distinguish the two, confused monsters are said to be afflicted by "monster confusion". Using a [stethoscope](/wiki/Stethoscope "Stethoscope") or a [wand of probing](/wiki/Wand_of_probing "Wand of probing") will reveal if the monster is confused. Monsters have a 1/50 chance of losing the monster confusion status on their turn.[\[33\]](#cite_note-33) If monsters have access to a non-cursed [unicorn horn](/wiki/Unicorn_horn "Unicorn horn") or a [lizard corpse](/wiki/Lizard_corpse "Lizard corpse") they will use it to clear the monster confusion status. Zapping healing spells at monsters (pets) does not un-confuse them, but bashing them with healing [potions](/wiki/Potion "Potion") does (and counts as [abuse](/wiki/Tameness#Abuse "Tameness")).

When a monster is confused they exhibit different behavior:

- Monsters may attack a random adjacent target instead of the player. This includes enemies without weapons who will attack [cockatrices](/wiki/Cockatrice "Cockatrice"), [chickatrices](/wiki/Chickatrice "Chickatrice") and [Medusa](/wiki/Medusa "Medusa") and may [stone](/wiki/Petrification "Petrification") themselves.[\[34\]](#cite_note-34)
- Monsters that cast spells have a higher spell failure chance. For each spell cast, a random number chosen between (\[1 to Monster's Level] \* 10) is chosen - if this is less than 100, then the monster's spell will fail to cast. This gives the message **The air crackles around \<caster>.**[\[35\]](#cite_note-35)
- Monsters may wander in a random direction instead of attacking
- Monsters that can read scrolls will do so incorrectly and will be affected by the confused behavior as per the scroll
- Monsters have less chance of avoiding an exploding [drawbridge](/wiki/Drawbridge "Drawbridge")
- Monsters cannot block incoming [kicks](/wiki/Kick "Kick")
- Monsters cannot shoot multiple projectiles

To inflict monster confusion on a target, the player can do one of the following:

- Hit a monster with a melee attack while under the effects of a [scroll of confuse monster](/wiki/Scroll_of_confuse_monster "Scroll of confuse monster")
- Hit a monster with [Magicbane](/wiki/Magicbane "Magicbane"), which may randomly trigger the monster confusion effect[\[36\]](#cite_note-36)
- Hit a monster with a thrown [potion of confusion](/wiki/Potion_of_confusion "Potion of confusion")
- Have a tame umber hulk use its gaze attack against a monster
- Have a tame black light attack a monster by exploding
- Be polymorphed into an umber hulk and use the [#Monster command](/wiki/Monster_\(command\) "Monster (command)") against a monster
- Be polymorphed into a [black light](/wiki/Black_light "Black light") and attack a monster by exploding
- Apply a [looking glass](/wiki/Looking_glass "Looking glass") to a non-[blind](/wiki/Blind "Blind") [umber hulk](/wiki/Umber_hulk "Umber hulk")
- [Revive](/wiki/Revive "Revive") a [bones file](/wiki/Bones_file "Bones file") corpse that has the awake bones file ghost on or adjacent to the square the corpse is on. The resulting monster will be confused.

## Variants

### SLASH'EM

In [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), confusion can be used with [shopkeeper services](/wiki/Shopkeeper_services "Shopkeeper services") to make [unholy water](/wiki/Unholy_water "Unholy water"). When confused, use the uncursing service on a [potion of water](/wiki/Potion_of_water "Potion of water"). "You accidentally ask for the item to be cursed!" The potion of water will be cursed.

### UnNetHack

In [UnNetHack](/wiki/UnNetHack "UnNetHack") [monks](/wiki/Monk "Monk") get a bonus of a single point of AC while confused, as a reference to the idea of drunken boxing. This bonus applies to confusion from any source however, not just the confusion from a potion of booze.

## History

In *[Hack](/wiki/Hack "Hack")*, [bats](/wiki/Bat "Bat") could cause confusion. *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")* has now differentiated this so that [stun](/wiki/Stun "Stun") and confusion are not the same. Bats and trapped [doors](/wiki/Door "Door") can stun you; this causes you to move in random directions, like confusion would. However, only confusion will let you obtain different effects from reading scrolls.

In NetHack 3.4.3, confused throne looting was an efficient way to [farm monsters](/wiki/Farming#Throne_farming "Farming").

## See also

- [Stun](/wiki/Stun "Stun")
- [Impaired](/wiki/Impaired "Impaired")

Confusion

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search

Confusion, or the state of being confused, is a property that affects you.

Being confused is generally bad, although some scrolls have useful effects if read while confused.

Causes

Some of these actions have other bad effects in addition to causing confusion. If you are deliberately seeking to be confused, you may want to lock yourself in a closet so that monsters can't gang up on you.

  • Attempting to cast a forgotten spell (can also stun you).[1]
  • Quaffing a potion of confusion or a non-blessed potion of booze.[2][3]
  • Being affected by vapors of a potion of confusion or potion of booze.[4]
  • Reading a cursed scroll of confuse monster, or any scroll of confuse monster while polymorphed into any non-​@, or casting the equivalent spell while so polymorphed.[5]
  • Eating a rotten egg, a tin of something rotten, or a tripe ration as a non-orc/caveman/canine in an attempt to become nauseated (any food item has a chance of making you vomit, but eggs and tripe rations have the highest chance. You will need to wait some time to be confused, and cure the nauseating side-effect as well).
  • Applying a cursed unicorn horn. May cause other bad effects, including terminal illness. [6]
  • Applying a mirror to yourself while polymorphed into an umber hulk.[7]
  • Applying a charged crystal ball unsuccessfully (may cause other bad effects).[8]
  • Reading a cursed or difficult spellbook (may cause other bad effects).[9]
  • Trying to magic-map a non-mappable level.[10]
  • Sitting on a throne.[11]
  • Being hit by Magicbane. This includes throwing it upward <.
  • Being exposed to an umber hulk's gaze attack.[12]
  • Being attacked by a monster that casts Confuse (monster spell).
  • Being hit by Yeenoghu.

Effects

  • You cannot cast spells.[13]
  • Attempting to loot while confused will find an object that is already in your inventory or cause you to drop some gold on the floor.[14]
  • Looting a throne while confused has other effects; see throne.
  • You will not be asked for confirmation before attacking peaceful monsters.
  • When you walk, aim, or apply certain tools in a direction, there is a 20% chance of a random direction being chosen instead (similar to being stunned, which has a 100% chance).[15][16][17][18][19]
  • When reading scrolls, you will mispronounce the magic words, which will cause different effects from what would occur normally.[20]
  • Reading any spellbook will instead make you tear the book into pieces (1/3 chance) or else you will simply fail to learn it. ("You find yourself reading the <first/next> line over and over again.")[21]
  • Wisdom is abused.[22]
  • You cannot throw or fire more than one projectile at a time.[23]
  • If you throw Mjollnir or an aklys, the weapon will not return to your hand.[24]
  • Your ability to engrave is impaired.[25]
  • Your ability to play music is impaired. You cannot play a tune, and any magical instrument will behave as if you were playing its mundane counterpart.[26][27]
  • You are less able to saddle a steed and cannot mount it.[28][29]
  • You cannot teleport at will.[30]
  • You may be unable to control a level teleport ("Oops...") even if you have teleport control (4/5 chance of uncontrolled level teleport at zero luck).[31]

Cures

  • Applying a non-cursed unicorn horn.
  • Eating a lizard corpse (reduces the timeout to 2 turns).
  • Praying (confusion counts as a minor trouble).
  • Reading a blessed scroll of confuse monster.
  • Waiting for it to wear off.

Confused scroll effects

When you are confused, most scrolls have different effects.[32]

See the individual scroll pages for detailed information.

Monster confusion

Monsters can be confused as well, but the effects on monsters are not identical to those that players experience. To distinguish the two, confused monsters are said to be afflicted by "monster confusion". Using a stethoscope or a wand of probing will reveal if the monster is confused. Monsters have a 1/50 chance of losing the monster confusion status on their turn.[33] If monsters have access to a non-cursed unicorn horn or a lizard corpse they will use it to clear the monster confusion status. Zapping healing spells at monsters (pets) does not un-confuse them, but bashing them with healing potions does (and counts as abuse).

When a monster is confused they exhibit different behavior:

  • Monsters may attack a random adjacent target instead of the player. This includes enemies without weapons who will attack cockatrices, chickatrices and Medusa and may stone themselves.[34]
  • Monsters that cast spells have a higher spell failure chance. For each spell cast, a random number chosen between ([1 to Monster's Level] * 10) is chosen - if this is less than 100, then the monster's spell will fail to cast. This gives the message The air crackles around <caster>.[35]
  • Monsters may wander in a random direction instead of attacking
  • Monsters that can read scrolls will do so incorrectly and will be affected by the confused behavior as per the scroll
  • Monsters have less chance of avoiding an exploding drawbridge
  • Monsters cannot block incoming kicks
  • Monsters cannot shoot multiple projectiles

To inflict monster confusion on a target, the player can do one of the following:

  • Hit a monster with a melee attack while under the effects of a scroll of confuse monster
  • Hit a monster with Magicbane, which may randomly trigger the monster confusion effect[36]
  • Hit a monster with a thrown potion of confusion
  • Have a tame umber hulk use its gaze attack against a monster
  • Have a tame black light attack a monster by exploding
  • Be polymorphed into an umber hulk and use the #Monster command against a monster
  • Be polymorphed into a black light and attack a monster by exploding
  • Apply a looking glass to a non-blind umber hulk
  • Revive a bones file corpse that has the awake bones file ghost on or adjacent to the square the corpse is on. The resulting monster will be confused.

Variants

SLASH'EM

In SLASH'EM, confusion can be used with shopkeeper services to make unholy water. When confused, use the uncursing service on a potion of water. "You accidentally ask for the item to be cursed!" The potion of water will be cursed.

UnNetHack

In UnNetHack monks get a bonus of a single point of AC while confused, as a reference to the idea of drunken boxing. This bonus applies to confusion from any source however, not just the confusion from a potion of booze.

History

In Hack, bats could cause confusion. NetHack has now differentiated this so that stun and confusion are not the same. Bats and trapped doors can stun you; this causes you to move in random directions, like confusion would. However, only confusion will let you obtain different effects from reading scrolls.

In NetHack 3.4.3, confused throne looting was an efficient way to farm monsters.

rawPage: '''Confusion''', or the state of being '''confused''', is a [[property]] that affects [[you]]. Being confused is generally bad, although some scrolls have useful effects if read while confused. == Causes == Some of these actions have other bad effects in addition to causing confusion. If you are deliberately seeking to be confused, you may want to lock yourself in a closet so that monsters can't gang up on you. * Attempting to cast a forgotten [[spell]] (can also [[stun]] you).{{refsrc|src/spell.c|842|nethack=3.6.7}} * [[Quaff]]ing a [[potion of confusion]] or a non-blessed [[potion of booze]].{{refsrc|src/potion.c|911|nethack=3.6.7}}{{refsrc|src/potion.c|700|nethack=3.6.7}} * Being affected by vapors of a [[potion of confusion]] or [[potion of booze]].{{refsrc|src/potion.c|1704|nethack=3.6.7}} * Reading a cursed [[scroll of confuse monster]], or any scroll of confuse monster while polymorphed into any non-{{monclasssym|@}}, or casting the [[spellbook of confuse monster|equivalent spell]] while so polymorphed.{{refsrc|src/read.c|1199|nethack=3.6.7}} * Eating a rotten [[egg]], a [[tin]] of something rotten, or a [[tripe ration]] as a non-orc/caveman/canine in an attempt to become nauseated (any food item has a chance of making you vomit, but eggs and tripe rations have the highest chance. You will need to wait some time to be confused, and cure the nauseating side-effect as well). * Applying a cursed [[unicorn horn]].
